newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Piltel down 9.43 pct on talk of low net --traders.
newsitem.headline: Piltel down 9.43 pct on talk of low net --traders.

text.p: Piltel shares shed 2.50 pesos, or 9.43 percent, to 24 pesos by midsession on Friday due to persistent talk of low earnings for the first nine months of the year, brokers said.
"It's the same story. The speculation is that third quarter earnings may not be attractive," said Fritz Aclan, research head of Dharmala Securities (Phils) Inc.
Aclan said he is trimming his full-year income projection for the mobile phone company by 10 percent from 1.3 billion pesos.
Piltel officials were not immediately available for comment.
Brokers said Piltel shares started to weaken late last week on talk of low earnings.
